front.note: Confidential: not for distribution. Submitted to IOP Publishing for peer review

docTitle.titlePart:
Multipeak ferromagnetic resonance behaviour tailored by
magnetoelastic coupling in FeSiB/CoNi layered microwires

byline.docAuthor: J. Torrejón, G. A. Badini-Confalonieri and M. Vázquez

front.div:
Abstract.-
The aim of this work is to report on the influence of the presence of a
magnetically hard layer with large thickness in the ferromagnetic resonance behaviour
of soft/hard biphase microwires. Such microwires consist of FeSiB soft nucleus,
intermediate glass layer and CoNi hard outer shell, and are prepared by combined
quenching and drawing technique with electrochemical deposition. The unusual FMR
response observed for this biphase system is characterised by the presence of a
multipeak absorption spectrum that depends on the static field and on the thickness of
the hard phase by means of magnetoelastic coupling. For thick enough CoNi layer, the
internal stresses induced in the nucleus during electroplating process are very strong,
giving rise to three electromagnetic absorptions: one at low frequency related to CoNi
shell and two more at higher frequencies corresponding to the FeSiB nucleus which are
ascribed to two well-defined magnetization regions with different magnetic anisotropy.
front.keywords:
KeyWords: Multipeak Ferromagnetic Resonance; Biphase magnetic microwires;
Magnetoelastic coupling.
front.introduction: Introduction: on the FMR of magnetic microwires.-
